tossupQ:
MATH Multiple Choice For numbers < 10 (read as: less than or equal to 10), and not 
including the number 1, how many are prime numbers? 
 
W) 3 
X) 4 
Y) 5 
Z) 2
bonusQ: MATH Short Answer Factor the expression: x<sup>2</sup> + 3x – 10

tossupQ:
LIFE SCIENCE Multiple Choice A summary reaction for photosynthesis is: 
 
W) CO2 + O2 + H<sub>2</sub>O and light yields carbohydrate + O2
X) CO2 + H<sub>2</sub>O and light yields carbohydrate + O2
Y) CO2 + H<sub>2</sub>O and light yields carbohydrate + H<sub>2</sub>O 
Z)  CO2 + O2 + H<sub>2</sub>O and light yields carbohydrate + H<sub>2</sub>O
tossupA: X) CO2 + H<sub>2</sub>O AND LIGHT YIELDS CARBOHYDRATE + O2
bonusQ:
LIFE SCIENCE Multiple Choice It is generally believed that most of the oxygen in the air 
today came from: 
 
W) oxidation of carbon molecules containing oxygen 
X) release of oxygen from volcanic vents 
Y) photosynthesis 
Z) forest fires
bonusA:
Y) PHOTOSYNTHESIS 
Junior National Science Bowl Single Elimination 1 Page 1

tossupQ:
LIFE SCIENCE Multiple Choice Osmosis is: 
 
W) the movement of water through a permeable membrane 
X) the movement of salts through a semi-permeable membrane 
Y) the movement of water through a semi-permeable membrane 
Z) the pressure exerted by water through a semi-permeable membrane
tossupA:
Y) THE MOVEMENT OF WATER THROUGH A SEMI-PERMEABLE 
MEMBRANE
bonusQ:
LIFE SCIENCE Multiple Choice Which of the following is most accurate about the 
pasteurization of milk: 
 
W) it makes milk taste better 
X) it kills all bacteria by sterilizing the milk 
Y) it lowers the milk’s pH 
Z) it reduces the population of bacteria by heating but not boiling the milk
bonusA:
Z) IT REDUCES THE POPULATION OF BACTERIA BY HEATING BUT NOT 
BOILING THE MILK

W) snow

bonusQ:
GENERAL SCIENCE  Multiple Choice What part of the cotton plant produces what is 
used to make cotton fabric. 
 
W) flowers or seed pods 
X) fibers in the stems 
Y) root hairs 
Z) fibers in the leaves
bonusA:
W) FLOWERS OR SEED PODS 
(Solution: The flowers of the cotton plant develop into seed pods and the seeds inside the pods 
are surrounded with an abundance of fine white hairs which are used to produce long strands or 
filaments of cotton thread.)
